intro: Octarrhena cladophylax, commonly known as the desert spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, often arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Octarrhena cladophylax is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
